evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On February 11, 2025, President Trump issued the Executive Order 14210 that is the subject of this lawsuit. Executive Order 14210 (hereinafter “Workforce Executive Order” or “Executive Order 14210”) ordered all federal agencies to “commence[]” a “critical transformation of the Federal bureaucracy” for the purported purpose of “eliminating waste, bloat, and insularity.”

extracted.value: President Donald J. Trump issued Executive Order 14210 on February 11, 2025, ordering federal agencies to commence large‑scale reductions in force (RIFs) and reorganize the federal workforce.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On February 11, 2025, President Trump issued the Executive Order 14210 that is the subject of this lawsuit. Executive Order 14210 (hereinafter “Workforce Executive Order” or “Executive Order 14210”) ordered all federal agencies to commence[] a “critical transformation of the Federal bureaucracy” for the purported purpose of “eliminating waste, bloat, and insularity,” including by conducting “large‑scale” Reductions in Force (“RIFs”) to further the reorganization of the federal agencies—all without any Congressional authorization.

extracted.value: On February 11, 2025, President Trump issued Executive Order 14210 that ordered all federal agencies to commence a "critical transformation of the Federal bureaucracy" for the purpose of "eliminating waste, bloat, and insularity," including conducting large‑scale Reductions in Force (RIFs) without Congressional authorization.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: 1. The President does not possess authority to reorganize, downsize, or otherwise transform the agencies of the federal government, unless and until Congress authorizes such action.

extracted.value: The President does not possess authority to reorganize, downsize, or otherwise transform the agencies of the federal government, unless and until Congress authorizes such action.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The President immediately ordered DOGE, along with the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) and the Office of Personnel Management (OPM), to create a plan to reduce the size of the Federal Government’s workforce.

extracted.value: The President immediately ordered DOGE, along with the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) and the Office of Personnel Management (OPM), to create a plan to reduce the size of the Federal Government’s workforce.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Agencies are required to prioritize any “agency initiatives, components, or operations that my Administration suspends or closes” (irrespective of statutory requirements, obligations, or authority delegated to the agencies);

extracted.value: Agencies are required to prioritize any ‘agency initiatives, components, or operations that my Administration suspends or closes’ (irrespective of statutory requirements, obligations, or authority delegated to the agencies).

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On January 20, 2025, the President created DOGE to engage in his project of radically transforming the size of the federal government.

extracted.value: On January 20, 2025, the President created the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) to engage in a project of radically transforming the size of the federal government.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The President required OMB to submit a plan within 90 days.

extracted.value: The President required OMB to submit a reorganization plan within 90 days of the EO.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: President Trump announced a hiring freeze on Jan. 20, 2025.

extracted.value: President Trump announced a federal hiring freeze on January 20, 2025.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: In late March, pursuant to the mandate of Executive Order 14210, the Department of Health and Human Services (“HHS”) began eliminating more than 10,000 positions throughout the Center for Disease Control (“CDC”), Food and Drug Administration (“FDA”), National Institutes of Health (“NIH”), among other programs, throwing the medical, public health, and scientific community into utter chaos.

extracted.value: In late March, pursuant to the mandate of Executive Order 14210, the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) began eliminating more than 10,000 positions throughout the CDC, FDA, NIH, among other programs.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Executive Order 14210 (hereinafter “Workforce Executive Order” or “Executive Order 14210”) ordered all federal agencies to commence[] a “critical transformation of the Federal bureaucracy” for the purported purpose of “eliminating waste, bloat, and insularity,”

extracted.value: Executive Order 14210 was issued to eliminate waste, bloat, and insularity by the President.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Agencies are required to commence large-scale RIFs (irrespective of whether staffing reductions are necessary or even appropriate in light of agency functions, obligations, or appropriations);

extracted.value: The EO directed agencies to freeze hiring and allow OMB and DOGE to control future hiring.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On March 13, 2017, during his first term, President Trump issued Executive Order 13781, which required the Director of OMB “to propose a plan to reorganize governmental functions and eliminate unnecessary agencies ... , components of agencies, and agency programs.” Exec. Order No. 13781, 82 Fed. Reg. 13959 (2017).

extracted.value: On March 13, 2017, during his first term, President Trump issued Executive Order 13781, which required the Director of OMB “to propose a plan to reorganize governmental functions and eliminate unnecessary agencies ... , components of agencies, and agency programs.” Exec. Order No. 13781, 82 Fed. Reg. 13959 (2017).
